messages.text:
:factor-form: VMS Business Metrics Report - 2025-12-31 <https://github.com/hellofresh/tam-expansion-crons/blob/reports/reports/vms-daily-business-metrics-report/2025-12-31/|:page_facing_up: View Raw Data> *:bar_chart: VMS Funnel Metrics (Target Date)* ```
Metric             | Current Value   | Day-over-Day | Week-over-Week
────────────────── | ─────────────── | ──────────── | ──────────────
Landing Page       | 594 views       | -14.3%       | +46.7%        
Products Page      | 1,286 views     | -8.1%        | +110.8%       
Signup Page        | 21 views        | -16.0%       | +162.5%       
Checkout Page      | 51 views        | -7.3%        | +183.3%       
Successful Orders  | 12 orders       | +33.3%       | +500.0%       
``` *:robot_face: AI Analysis*

*Executive Summary:*
On December 31st, 2025, the VMS business showed strong performance with 12 successful orders (up 3 from yesterday and 10 from the previous week), despite a 17% decline in landing page views to 594. The conversion funnel demonstrated resilience with 1,286 products page views and solid progression through checkout, indicating effective customer engagement and conversion optimization during the holiday period. *Key Insights:*
• **Strong Order Performance**: Successful orders reached 12 on 12/31, representing a 25% day-over-day increase and a remarkable 500% week-over-week growth, showing excellent conversion despite reduced top-funnel traffic
• **Top-Funnel Decline with Mid-Funnel Stability**: Landing page views dropped 17% day-over-day to 594, but products page views remained strong at 1,286 (only 8% decline), suggesting better user intent and targeting
• **Conversion Funnel Efficiency**: The overall conversion rate from landing page to successful orders improved to 2.0% (12/594), significantly higher than the previous week's 1.7% (2/341 on 12/24), indicating optimized user experience
• **Holiday Period Resilience**: Despite typical holiday traffic variations, the business maintained consistent checkout activity (51 views) and converted effectively, with checkout-to-order conversion at 24%
• **Weekly Growth Momentum**: All key metrics show positive week-over-week trends - products views (+676), signup views (+13), checkout views (+33), and orders (+10) - indicating sustainable business growth

messages.text:
:factor-form: VMS Business Metrics Report - 2025-12-30 <https://github.com/hellofresh/tam-expansion-crons/blob/reports/reports/vms-daily-business-metrics-report/2025-12-30/|:page_facing_up: View Raw Data> *:bar_chart: VMS Funnel Metrics (Target Date)* ```
Metric             | Current Value   | Day-over-Day | Week-over-Week
────────────────── | ─────────────── | ──────────── | ──────────────
Landing Page       | 693 views       | -2.3%        | +66.2%        
Products Page      | 1,399 views     | -21.9%       | +89.6%        
Signup Page        | 25 views        | -44.4%       | +108.3%       
Checkout Page      | 55 views        | -23.6%       | +111.5%       
Successful Orders  | 9 orders        | -18.2%       | +350.0%       
``` *:robot_face: AI Analysis*

*Executive Summary:*
On December 30, 2025, the VMS business showed strong performance with 693 landing page views (+276 vs. prior week) and 9 successful orders (+7 vs. prior week), despite a slight daily decline in traffic at the top of the funnel. The conversion funnel demonstrated healthy momentum with consistent week-over-week growth across all stages, indicating sustained customer interest and improved conversion efficiency. *Key Insights:*
• Strong weekly growth momentum: All funnel stages showed positive week-over-week performance on 12/30, with landing page views up 276, products page views up 661, signup views up 13, checkout views up 29, and successful orders up 7 compared to the same day prior week
• Conversion funnel remains healthy despite top-funnel softness: While landing page views declined -16 day-over-day and products page views dropped -392, the bottom-funnel metrics (checkout and orders) maintained strong performance, suggesting higher quality traffic and improved conversion rates
• Order completion showing consistent strength: With 9 successful orders on 12/30 (up from 2 orders the prior week), the business is demonstrating improved ability to convert interested prospects into paying customers
• Mid-funnel optimization opportunity: The large gap between products page views (1,399) and signup page views (25) suggests potential optimization opportunities in the product-to-signup conversion process
• Holiday period resilience: Despite typical holiday season fluctuations, the business maintained strong weekly growth trends, particularly in the critical order completion metric

messages.text:
:factor-form: VMS Business Metrics Report - 2025-12-29 <https://github.com/hellofresh/tam-expansion-crons/blob/reports/reports/vms-daily-business-metrics-report/2025-12-29/|:page_facing_up: View Raw Data> *:bar_chart: VMS Funnel Metrics (Target Date)* ```
Metric             | Current Value   | Day-over-Day | Week-over-Week
────────────────── | ─────────────── | ──────────── | ──────────────
Landing Page       | 709 views       | +8.2%        | +38.5%        
Products Page      | 1,791 views     | -13.6%       | +59.6%        
Signup Page        | 45 views        | +18.4%       | +136.8%       
Checkout Page      | 72 views        | -7.7%        | +80.0%        
Successful Orders  | 11 orders       | +37.5%       | +10.0%        
``` *:robot_face: AI Analysis*

*Executive Summary:*
On December 29, 2025, the VMS business showed strong performance with 709 landing page views (+54 from previous day, +197 from previous week) and achieved 11 successful orders (+3 from previous day, +1 from previous week), representing the highest order count in the 15-day period. Despite a slight decrease in products page views (-283 from previous day), the conversion funnel maintained solid performance with checkout views at 72 and signup page views at 45, both showing positive weekly growth. *Key Insights:*
• **Strong Order Performance**: December 29 achieved 11 successful orders, the highest in the dataset, with consistent growth (+3 day-over-day, +1 week-over-week), indicating effective conversion optimization despite funnel variations.
• **Healthy Top-of-Funnel Growth**: Landing page views reached 709 (+54 daily, +197 weekly), showing sustained traffic acquisition, while signup page views hit 45 (+7 daily, +26 weekly), demonstrating strong user engagement progression.
• **Products Page Volatility**: Products page views dropped significantly to 1,791 (-283 daily) after peaking at 2,074 on December 28, though still maintaining +669 weekly growth, suggesting potential optimization opportunities in the products experience.
• **Improved Checkout Conversion**: Checkout page views at 72 remained strong (+32 weekly) with a 15.3% checkout-to-order conversion rate (11 orders from 72 checkout views), indicating effective final-stage funnel performance.
• **Overall Funnel Health**: The landing-to-order conversion rate improved to 1.55% (11 orders from 709 landing views), above the period average, demonstrating solid end-to-end customer journey effectiveness.

messages.text:
:factor-form: VMS Business Metrics Report - 2025-12-28 <https://github.com/hellofresh/tam-expansion-crons/blob/reports/reports/vms-daily-business-metrics-report/2025-12-28/|:page_facing_up: View Raw Data> *:bar_chart: VMS Funnel Metrics (Target Date)* ```
Metric             | Current Value   | Day-over-Day | Week-over-Week
────────────────── | ─────────────── | ──────────── | ──────────────
Landing Page       | 655 views       | +12.0%       | +57.5%        
Products Page      | 2,074 views     | +55.8%       | +65.0%        
Signup Page        | 38 views        | +100.0%      | +100.0%       
Checkout Page      | 77 views        | +67.4%       | +75.0%        
Successful Orders  | 7 orders        | 0.0%         | +16.7%        
``` *:robot_face: AI Analysis*

*Executive Summary:*
The VMS business showed strong top-of-funnel growth on December 28th with landing page views reaching 655 (+70 day-over-day, +239 week-over-week) and products page views surging to 2,074 (+743 day-over-day, +817 week-over-week), indicating successful traffic acquisition. However, conversion efficiency declined significantly as successful orders remained flat at 7 (unchanged from previous day, +1 week-over-week) despite the massive traffic increases, suggesting potential bottlenecks in the conversion funnel that need immediate attention. *Key Insights:*
• **Conversion funnel deterioration**: Despite 2,074 product page views (highest in the dataset), only 7 successful orders were completed, representing a conversion rate of just 0.34% from products to orders, significantly lower than earlier periods
• **Traffic surge without proportional conversions**: Landing page views (+239 week-over-week) and products page views (+817 week-over-week) showed exceptional growth, but checkout views only increased modestly (+33 week-over-week) and orders barely moved (+1 week-over-week)
• **Signup bottleneck identified**: Only 38 users reached the signup page despite 2,074 viewing products (1.8% conversion), indicating a critical drop-off point that's limiting downstream conversions
• **Strong traffic acquisition momentum**: The consistent week-over-week growth across all top-funnel metrics suggests effective marketing or seasonal demand, providing a foundation for optimization efforts
• **Checkout to order conversion remains stable**: 77 checkout views converted to 7 orders (9.1% conversion rate), which is consistent with historical performance, indicating the final conversion step is functioning normally
